details.title: Toss update
details.content:
India won the toss and elected to field first.

India win the toss and elect to bowl first #AUSvIND pic.twitter.com/8XMJfHjNSB

— cricket.com.au (@cricketcomau) November 23, 2018

details.title: Bhuvneshwar Kumar strikes early!
details.content: Australia skipper Aaron Finch dismissed for a golden duck!

details.title: First six of the game!
details.content: Chriss Lynn pulls away Bhuvi's piched up delivery to fetch the first maximum of the match.

details.title: Wicket!
details.content: Dangerous Chirs Lynn is dismissed by young Khaleel Ahmed at the end of an undisciplined-looking over. Australia in trouble.

details.title: Score
details.content: Australia 34/2 in 5 Overs

details.title: Bowling change
details.content: Kohli introduces Jasprit Bumrah into the attack.

details.title: Wicket!
details.content: D'Arcy Short cleaned bowled by Khaleel! Second wicket for the seamer today.

details.title: Score
details.content: Australia 62-4 after 10.3 Overs

details.title: Wicket!
details.content: Big-hitting Maxwell sent packing for 19 by Krunal Pandya.

details.title: Smart bowling
details.content: Kuldeep Yadav is the only Indian bowler not to get a wicket so far in the match.

details.title: Australia struggles
details.content: With the top-five gone, the Baggy Greens are struggling in the middle. Their run rate has fallen to 5.69 runs per over.

details.title: Wicket!
details.content:
Kuldeep strikes! Alex Carey departs for just 4 runs off 5 balls.
Australia 74/6 after 13.1 Overs.

details.title: Six!
details.content: Nathan Coulet-Nile smashes Kuldeep for a maximum!

details.title: Harsha Tweets
details.content:
With Raina not around, Manish Pandey not in the 11, Rahane not picked and Jadeja in and out, India's fielding isn't as sharp.

— Harsha Bhogle (@bhogleharsha) November 23, 2018

details.title: Four more
details.content: Coulter- Nile moves to double-figures with a boundary off a Krunal Pandya delivery.

details.title: Score
details.content: Australia 91/6 after 15 Overs

details.title: Bowling change
details.content:
Bhuvi to ball his third over of the game


(Photo | AP)

details.title: Sixer!
details.content: Coulter-Niles pulls away a short-pitched deliver from Kumar to find the second six of his innings.

details.title: Wicket!
details.content: Coulter-Niles' innings end in Kuldeep Yadav's hands as he tries to play another big shot. Second wicket for Bhuvi.

details.title: Score
details.content: Australia 101-7 after 16 Overs

details.title: Australia's poor batting continues
details.content: Australia's Glenn Maxwell is clean bowled by Krunal Pandya as Rishabh Pant watches from behind (Photo | AP)

details.title: All eyes on McDermott
details.content: Australia is pinning all their hopes for a decent total on Ben McDermott - the last recognised batsman surviving. (Photo | AP)

details.title: Score
details.content: Australia 113-7 in 17.3 Overs

details.title: Sixer!
details.content: McDermott runs riot as Australia's run rate crosses 7 per over.

details.title: Score
details.content: Australia 127/7 after 18 Overs

details.title: Too many dot balls
details.content: The Indian bowlers have managed 55 dot balls so far with 12 balls left to play. (Photo | AP)

details.title: Super Bumrah!
details.content: India's death-over specialist had another wonderful outing. (4-0-20-1) (Photo | AP)

details.title: Score
details.content: Australia 132/7 after 19 Overs

details.title: Rain stops play
details.content: Rain interrupts the game with just over left to play in the Australian innings.

details.title: Happy fans
details.content: Indian fans cheer during the Twenty20 international cricket match between India and Australia in Melbourne. (Photo | AP)

details.title: Bowling stats
details.content: All Indian bowlers except Khaleel Ahmed have managed an economy rate under 7 rpo.

details.title: Two rain-hit matches in a row
details.content: Indian captain Virat KOhli interacts with the umpires as rain starts pouring at the Melboure Cricket Ground (Photo | AP)

details.title: Update
details.content: Australia will get to play the final over of the innings when game resumes shortly.

details.title: Match remains suspended
details.content: Players forced off the field again as rain returns to Melbourne Cricket Ground.

details.title: Ten minutes left before the cut-off time
details.content: Though the players are warming up, the covers are back on the field as rain intensifies.

details.title: BCCI Tweets
details.content:
#TeamIndia need 90 runs in 11 overs (DLS) to win the 2nd T20I.#AUSvIND pic.twitter.com/KFtgGtULjf

— BCCI (@BCCI) November 23, 2018

details.title: Save it for the final match boys
details.content:
Let's do this #AUSvIND pic.twitter.com/tqhpr3tfHo

— BCCI (@BCCI) November 23, 2018

details.title: BCCI confirms match being abandoned
details.content:
Sadly, the play has been called off at the MCG. Australia take a 1-0 series lead with one more game to go.#AUSvIND pic.twitter.com/C3b9iKxNM2

— BCCI (@BCCI) November 23, 2018
